articles.title: Argentina’s far-right frontrunner reopens wounds of dictatorship
articles.description: Javier Milei has provoked alarm and outrage by downplaying the number of victims of the country’s 1976-83 military rule
articles.content:
A sign outside the subterranean torture chamber welcomed victims to “The Avenue of Happiness”.
A gramophone played a rock song on loop to muffle their screams: (I Can’t Get No) Satisfaction by the Rolling Stones.
“It wasn’t a horror film, it was real... [8910 chars]

articles.title: Fair City cancel episode for the second week in a row
articles.description: The usual Friday night episode won't air on RTÉ One on October 20 due to a "drop date" as Rugby World Cup semi-final between Argentina v New Zealand airs at 8pm

articles.title: Argentina vs New Zealand: Michael Cheika aims to guide Pumas to first Rugby World Cup final
articles.description: Argentina head coach Michael Cheika is aiming to reach his second Rugby World Cup final and the first in the Pumas' history.
articles.content:
Michael Cheika was in charge of Australia when the Wallabies lost the 2015 World Cup final to New Zealand
2023 Rugby World Cup semi-final: Argentina v New Zealand Venue: Stade de France, Paris Date: Friday, 20 October Kick-off: 20:00 BST Coverage: Co... [5882 chars]

articles.title: Renault sales up 7.6% thanks to higher prices but forex weighs
articles.description: French carmaker Renault said on Thursday its revenues rose by 7.6% in the third quarter thanks to sales of higher-end market models, though currency depreciations in Turkey and Argentina weighed heavily on the pace of growth.
articles.content:
A logo of Renault is seen on a car during the French carmaker Renault's 2022 annual results presentation in Boulogne-Billancourt, near Paris, Feburary 16, 2023. REUTERS/Christian Hartmann/File Photo Acquire Licensing Rights
Companies Renault SA Follo... [1584 chars]

articles.title: New Zealand head coach Ian Foster dismisses favouritism tag against Argentina
articles.description: Three-time champions New Zealand have lost just two of 36 matches against Los Pumas and are widely expected to prevail again in Paris on Friday.
articles.content:
Head coach Ian Foster has warned New Zealand the past counts for nothing as they head into their World Cup semi-final against Argentina as overwhelming favourites.
The three-time champions have lost just two of 36 matches against Los Pumas and are wi... [1681 chars]

articles.title: Cheika acknowledges Contepomi’s role in getting Argentina to World Cup semi-final
articles.description: Argentina head coach says the match is a ‘great opportunity’ for his team, and ‘we’re doing everything we can to try and take it’
articles.content: Argentina's head coach Michael Cheika (right) and attack coach Felipe Contepomi. 'Felipe has been unreal. He has a lot of good new ideas. One of his strengths is he’s extremely open to learning new things,' said Cheika. Photograph: Juan Mabromata/AFP... [6126 chars]

articles.title: After they were written off early, Pumas and All Blacks meet in World Cup semifinal
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Argentina and New Zealand weren’t supposed to get this far after losing their opening games at the Rugby World Cup. The Pumas were seen as no-hopers, the All Blacks perceived as a faded force.
articles.content:
PARIS (AP) — Argentina and New Zealand weren’t supposed to get this far after losing their opening games at the Rugby World Cup. The Pumas were seen as no-hopers, the All Blacks perceived as a faded force.
